forum.content:
兩週前，我為了見我朋友們，去了台中一日遊。
Two weeks ago, I went to Taichung for a day-trip to see my friends.

在去高美濕地的途中，我看到了一個美語補習班的立牌廣告，上面是一個白人教師和兩個台灣小朋友穿著印地安人的服飾。
On the way to Gaomei Wetlands, I saw this ad on a billboard for an English after-school institute, with a white male and two Taiwanese kids dressed as native Americans.

我當時想這看板也太冒犯人了，所以我就拍了張照發到我IG的限時動態。意料之內，我不是唯一個這麼想的，一個美國朋友也這麼覺得。
I thought it was really offensive so I took and posted an insta story. Unsurprisingly, I wasn't the only one who felt that way, but also an American friend who saw my story.

近幾年，在美國已經有越來越多人意識到「打扮成別國人」的議題，
Recent years, people in the states are more aware of the issue of "dressing up as people from other cultures",

因為那些裝扮通常放大與誇張化刻板印象，有時是負面的。
because they are usually magnifying/exaggerating stereotypes, sometimes negatively.

今天，我看到了這個影片，我之前已經看過了。不過我覺得這對一些人會是一個很好的提醒；或對於某些人是一個很好的訓誡，那些沒意識到對於其他文化無意的汙辱。
Then, today I saw this video, which I already saw before, but I thought it'd be a good reminder for some and good lesson for others who are not aware of their unintentional insults towards another culture.

引用影片中的女孩談論印地安人的頭飾：
Quoting this girl from the video when they talk about the headdresses:

「頭飾不是單純被給與或遞給的，你需要自己掙得頭飾上的每一個羽毛。如果你直接去買一個頭飾，那是很不敬的行為，因為那背後沒有任何意義，你什麼都沒有做，除了花錢買它而已。」
"It wasn't just given to them or handed to them, you have to earn every feather that makes up that headdress. If you were to buy a headdress, that'd be disrespectful because there's no meaning behind it. You didn't do anything to earn it - all you did was pay for it"

成為那有文化素養及有教育的人。之前不知道沒關係，但現在知道了，在未來可以做不同的決定，或是教育那些還不知道的人。
Be culturally sensitive, be educated. It is okay if you didn't know about it, but now you do, you can act differently and maybe educate others who still don't.

P.s 自打自翻譯，如有任何錯誤煩請告知以做修正💁🏻‍♂️

urls.description: Watch as Native American girls get real, and debunk 6 common misconceptions that their people face.
